Key Match Events: Wyatt Langford made a leaping, game-ending catch at the top of wall in left field on a 104 mph liner from Giancarlo Stanton with two runners on
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Aaron Boone emphasized the importance of playing their best ball and putting their best foot forward with 22 games to go
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Judge said they've still got a long month ahead of us, big series coming up here in Chicago, that's all you can really do is look forward
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees are currently without a specific closer after two-time All-Star Clay Holmes gave up Langford's drive with New York on the cusp of a series victory in the middle game against the Rangers
Others: The Yankees are just a half-game behind Baltimore for the AL East lead and the AL's best record
Gleyber Torres didn't realize a speedy Langford might try to turn an RBI hit from a single into a double and nonchalantly handled the cutoff throw
